p: Ultimately, successful control must be suited to local transmission dynamics. The strategy we describe here has the advantage of only modifying existing procedures by altering the timing and locations of fogging. While the costs for increased surveys and fogging might be greater, they are almost certainly outweighed by the savings in reduced dengue incidence [ 38, 39]. Since Ae. aegypti is also the primary vector of chikungunya and Zika viruses, which are endemic in Indonesia, the prevention of epidemics caused by those pathogens cannot be discounted.
